features: Built-in 20TB Capacity USB 3.0 External Hard Drive
Works for any WIndows OS Desktop PC, Laptop with USB 3.0 Port
Expand computer hard drive storage instantly! Add extra storage to your Desktop PC / Laptop Without opening up the case
Perfect for hard drive expansion and backup storage for your entire Windows OS system! (Do it before it crash, you never know when it will happen! "Daily schedule backup is no longer optional" )
body.description: Avolusion PRO-Z Series 20TB (20-Terabyte) External Hard Drive is the value hard drive upgrade kit provides the best and easy solution to expand your Desktop PC / Laptop storage capacity instantly! Plug and Play USB 3.0 interface providing a perfect portable storage solution for you to store & backup your game data, music, picture, video and more! Avolusion PRO-Z Series External Hard Drive designed to work with your Windows OS Desktop PC, Laptop perfectly! Fully compatible with any Windows OS devices. It comes with silent fan-less design to keep your External Hard Drive operate quietly! Avolusion PRO-Z Series External Hard Drive Upgrade Kit features high-quality construction, advanced external interface technology, durable chassis and state-of-the-art industrial design, assured to provide you with years of reliable performance. Features: Model: PROZ-WH-20TB-WIN Built-in 20TB Capacity Hard Drive Compatible with Windows 11, 10, 8, 7 Windows NTFS File System Pre-Formatted Expand computer hard drive storage instantly! Add extra storage to your Desktop PC / Laptop Without opening up the case Specification: Interface: USB 3.0 Built-In Capacity : 20TB Material: Plastic/PVC USB Data Speed: 5.0 Gbit/s Support Platform: Windows OS Color: White Dimension: 8"(L) x 5"(W) x 1.6"(H) Power Input: 100V ~ 240V (50-60Hz 0.8A) Power Output: 12V 2.0A Package Contents: Avolusion PRO-Z 20TB External Storage (Windows OS) USB 3.0 Cable Power Adapter User Manual 2 Years Warranty

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.2 4.2 out of 5 stars 21 ratings 4.2 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good
reviews.reviewText: Was a little apprehensive since I had not heard of the brand but the price was good especially compared to others. So far it's great and has a fast spin up time unlike my Western Digital drive that takes at least 1 seconds to spin up. This one is ready immediately. So far this was a good buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I needed a second backup for video files, and my previous order of two 20 TB WD external HDDs never left the supplier. It was on sale and I wasn't expecting much, so I was pleasantly surprised at how seamlessly it fit into my editing system, recently upgraded from Windows 10 to Apple Silicon Macintosh.All I had to do was quickly erase the NTFS file system and replace it with exFAT (compatible with Windows, Mac OS and many Linux distros), plug it into my USB 3 hub, and I was ready to rock.Next time this product's on sale I'll buy another one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars 300 dollar paper weight
reviews.reviewText: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!!!!! Pulled out of box plugged in, makes a lot of noise and computer doesn’t see the device! Not even in disk management tried 8 usb ports 3 type c cables and 3 computers nothing. I repeat do not waste your money on this product you will regret it, I definitely do!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Plenty of space. Very worth it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I bought this hard drive for myself on my birthday. I dumped the contents of my 12 TB and my 8 TB that didn’t have dupes and it handled the data quickly and quietly. I use it every day and am delighted with my birthday present!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The instructions indicate it for use on game machines but it worked fine on my Windows computer. The included usb cable is rather short.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: At the end of the day, this is an enclosure with a hard drive. What will determine the quality is mostly the type of drive inside. Thankfully, the Avolusion PRO-Z 20TB features a ridiculously easy case to open to see what's inside... There's a "void warranty" sticker on the outside, but, legality aside, for science this must be opened. The casing comes apart like the Playstation 5 casing (I mean, this thing even looks a bit like a PS5), - you just slide the white panels to the side, and you're left with just a few Phillips screws to remove.Once in, and... it's a Seagate EXOS 20TB 7200rpm enterprise drive. These are good drives, but you'd get a longer warranty buying the drive and grabbing your own enclosure, so bear this in mind. This comes with custom labeling on the drive, so nope, the serial number won't be recognized by Seagate for warranty purposes direct with them, - you'd need to go through Avolusion.Speeds are good in the plastic enclosure (no metal here), at around 250MB/s read and write connected to my Mac. It came formatted for Windows, but it only takes a few seconds to reformat for a Mac if you want to use it there.Overall, this is a good drive, but I feel like money is better spent on the drive and enclosure separately, for that longer warranty. That said, if you're not inclined, this is ready to go out of the box.4 out of 5. Good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023

reviews.reviewTitle: Funciona correctamente, fácil de instalar y usar.
reviews.reviewText: Llegó antes de tiempo programado por Amazon, como siempre un excelente servicio de entrega. Lo compre como respaldo para mi PC con windows 11. Lo conecté y al instante lo reconoció y funciona a la perfección. No fue necesario configurar nada. Cabe la pena aclarar que en realidad son 18 TB, por que 2 TB son utilizados por el sistema operativo, esto sucede con todos los discos duros. Llevo usándolo apenas unos días y espero que así sea por muchos años.
